alert.note: Alert for Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marion and southeastern Putnam Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Satsuma, or near Pomona Park. This storm was nearly stationary. Other showers were over far southern Putnam county nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Pomona Park, Salt Springs, Lake Delancy, Fruitland, Satsuma, Welaka, Lake Como and Georgetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
